results.title: Garden party
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gurian, ACI Films and Jack Sholder
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a short story by Katherine Mansfield, presenting a story about a garden party which continues uninterrupted by a neighbourhood death. Helps stimulate discussion on the meaning of death. A sensitive approach to a difficult theme. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.

results.title: Garden of the great spirit
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Amaranth Productions, Barry Gray and Gary Johnson
results.brief_description: The St Lawrence Islands National Park, located in the Thousand Islands, Ontario, is an area of great natural beauty and historic interest. Geography and weather have created a greater variety of plant life here than anywhere ales in Canada. The film points out the park’s main features while reminding the audience that conservation must be practised to protect the fragile balance of nature. Narrated by Cy Stranger, camera by David M. Ostricker.

results.title: Garden of Eden
results.brief_description: Overall winner of the 2002 ACMI Infogrames Diegesis, Garden of Eden was described by the judges as ‘aesthetically mature’ and ‘conceptually rich, reminiscent of the brothers Quay’. The filmmaker was attempting to explore the theme of ‘nature versus religion’ and this rather dark vision features mesmorising characters that occupy a surreal landscape with a haunting original soundtrack of strings.

results.title: Garden Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Hosted by Graham and Sandra Ross this video is a collection of helpful and practical hints for the home gardener, taken from their popular weekly TV series. The video is divided into four segments: The vegetable garden, The flower garden, Australian natives and a miscellaneous section which includes hanging baskets, terrariums, lawns and fruit fly control.

results.title: Garden = Jardin
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Christopher Nutter
results.brief_description: A film animation experiment in metaphoric imagery. This is a surrealistic garden where the earth seethes with strange, unusual shapes and activity, accelerated in movement, compressed in time. Insect-like creatures dart under and over the sand with elusive swiftness; Picasso-like faces stare momentarily upward, mutate, and disappear; wilted blossoms become suddenly animated. What happens on the screen is punctuated and accompanied by synthetic sound effects. Music by Bruce Mackay.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Christopher Nutter

results.title: Garde a Vue = the Grilling
results.creator_credit: George Dancigers, Alexandre Mnouchkine, Films Ariane, TF1 Films productions and Claude Miller
results.brief_description:
On New Year’s Eve, Inspector Antoine Gallien, assisted by Belmont are questioning local attorney Martinaud in regard to the rape and murder of two young girls whose bodies have been found on the beach. Martinaud knew one of the children. At first the questioning progresses politely, and then less so, as the interrogation team chips away at the suspect’s alibi and Martinaud becomes the prime suspect. Claude Miller’s film appears as a discreet homage to H.G. Clouzot’s ‘Quai des Orfevres’. Both films share the New Year’s Eve setting and the same names for the police inspectors. Awards: Prix Melies 1981 ; Grand Prix du Cinema Francais 1981 ; Montreal Film Festival - Best Scenario.

Credits: Producers, Alexandre Mnouchkine, Georges Dancigers ; director, Claude Miller ; writers, Michel Audiard, Jean Herman, Claude Miller ; photography, Bruno Nuytten ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Lino Ventura, Michel Serrault, Romy Schneider, Guy Marchand, Elsa Lunghini, Jean-Claude Penchenat, Pierre Maguelon, Mathieu Schiffman, Michel Such, Patrick Depeyrat.

results.title: Garbo
results.creator_credit: Hugh Rule, Eclectic Films, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Ron Cobb
results.brief_description: There’s a garbage war going on between private contractors with swish automated machines and local council workers - the automated vehicles cut out the work of the middleman who collects the bin manually. Two such middlemen are Steve and Neill, dedicated waste disposal workers on the garbage truck named “Garbo”. The comraderie of council garbage collectors is evident as the automated Sanicleanse workers have the support of police, who turn a blind eye to such shenanigans as the theft of Christmas presents left out by thoughtful clients. Plot twists include the theft of the truck and a seaside holiday with the shrewish, overbearing, agoraphobic Freda after Steve mishears a woman he helps out at work talking on the phone inviting her friend on a holiday. This love interest proves to be the local copper’s daughter and to complicate matters Steve hasn’t been honest about his profession. Written by Stephen Kearney and Neill Gladwin (Los Trios Ringbarkus), “Garbo” is an amusing if inconsequential lightweight comedy. Cast also includes: Max Cullen, Simon Chilvers, Gerard Kennedy, Moya O’Sullivan, Imogen Annesley, Michael Veitch, John Brumpton.

results.title: Garbage ouroboros
results.creator_credit: Milan Chuostek and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Municipal garbage is Public Enemy No. 1. While nature always recycles, man is the first animal who has broken the cycle. We must design for re-use, for to eliminate waste is to eliminate pollution. This program shows what amateurs and professionals are doing in Canada and the United States and makes suggestions for further strategies.
